title: [🐛 | Bug]: Crash on "Click to enlarge" QR code
body:
### Version

2.15.1-rc1

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Linux

### What happened ?

Steps to reproduce:

1. Open `My devices`
2. Click on `Invite a new device`
3. On the `Add a new device` dialog, click on the QR code to enlarge it
4. Click on the image to close
5. Click again to enlarge the QR code
6. :boom: CRASH

Edit: Crash also happens on step 3 if the mouse pointer is moved in and out the image.

### Relevant output

On first click on the image (step 3):
```shell
2023-04-03T09:33:21.866680Z [error    ] Exception in Qt slot           
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/snap/parsec/254/site-packages/parsec/core/gui/custom_widgets.py", line 315, in enterEvent
    self._draw_overlay()
  File "/snap/parsec/254/site-packages/parsec/core/gui/custom_widgets.py", line 349, in _draw_overlay
    if icon_scaled:
UnboundLocalError: local variable 'icon_scaled' referenced before assignment
```
On crash (step 5/6):
```shell
QPaintDevice: Cannot destroy paint device that is being painted
[1]    33625 segmentation fault  snap run parsec
```

title: Kotlin & gradle issue on versionning

labels.name: CI / CD
labels.description: Issue related to the CI / CD

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: java
labels.description: Pull requests that update Java code

body:
CI is failing due to a kotlin dependency being to recent for codeql

I think the issue is we don't pin the dependencies

    we just specify org.jetbrains.kotlin.android must be 1.8.0
    org.jetbrains.kotlin.android probably (I didn't check it own code so not 100% sure) depends on org.jetbrains.kotlin.jvm
    a new [version 1.8.10 of org.jetbrains.kotlin.jvm has been released](https://plugins.gradle.org/plugin/org.jetbrains.kotlin.jvm), so this is the one being used
    CodeQL complains `org.jetbrains.kotlin.jvm` is too recent

See https://docs.gradle.org/current/userguide/dependency_locking.html for a solution

On top of there is a warning in the node install because the wrong version of node is used. I think we should first focus on solving the Gradle pinning issue, then try to entirely disable the node stuff (so npm install and also compilation of the web project). It's possible the Android project won't be affected by this (or it is affected in a way we could touch a couple of files to simulate the build of the js project).

From this [discussion](https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/pull/4092#issuecomment-1459924595)

TODOs
-----

- [x] #4216
- [x] #4210
- [x] #4211

```python
    @pytest.mark.trio
    async def test_new_sharing_trigger_event(
        alice_core: LoggedCore,
        bob_core: LoggedCore,
        running_backend,
    ):
        KEY = SecretKey.generate()
        # First, create a folder and sync it on backend
        with freeze_time("2000-01-01", devices=[alice_core.device], freeze_datetime=True):
            wid = await alice_core.user_fs.workspace_create(EntryName("foo"))
        workspace = alice_core.user_fs.get_workspace(wid)
        with freeze_time("2000-01-02", devices=[alice_core.device], freeze_datetime=True):
            await workspace.sync()
    
        # Now we can share this workspace with Bob
        with bob_core.event_bus.listen() as spy:
            with freeze_time("2000-01-03", devices=[alice_core.device], freeze_datetime=True):
                await alice_core.user_fs.workspace_share( # <- this line get the BackendOffline exception
                    wid, recipient=UserID("bob"), role=WorkspaceRole.MANAGER
                )
```

title: :bug: Wrong use of exception in `parsec/core/local_device.py`
body:
## Intro

In `parsec/core/local_device.py` we define `LocalDeviceError`
But in `parsec._parsec` we also define `LocalDeviceError` and use it in the rust code.
That create problem when we do the following:

```python
try:
    # ...
except LocalDeviceError:
    pass
```

or an actual code example: https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/0e2f2d3d780a5528e38687de399b86834e87a09e/parsec/core/local_device.py#L79-L84

Because we `except` for the wrong exception (It have the same name but still)

## Mitigation

Use `parsec._parsec.LocalDeviceExc`

## Correction

1. Rename `parsec._parsec.LocalDeviceExc` to `parsec._parsec.LocalDeviceExc`
2. Replace `LocalDeviceError` definition in `parsec.core.local_device` by the `parsec._parsec` one

title: Compatibility broken with `ApiVersion`
body:
Since #3743 compatibility is broken because `ApiVersion` is packed as 2 ints instead of a tuple of ints.

As a result we might get an error like this with an older backend version:
```
{'supported_api_versions': {0: ['Not a ApiVersion'], 1: ['Not a ApiVersion'], 2: ['Not a ApiVersion']}}
```

body:
When `auto-merge` is enabled on PRs sometime when required step `ci is happy` is skipped because of a failure the resulting PR would be still merged into the base branch.

One work around would be that the job is always executed but fail if one of it's dependencies jobs fail.

title: Add test to check regex compat
body:
When a user has an older cache some regex contains escapes sequences like `\Z` which are not supported by rust `regex` crate. Note that `fancy_regex` has the same issue here.

This is a proposal to fix the issue (#3212) by replacing the unsupported escapes sequences. Although it works, there may be better ways to handle this issue.

title: Bugfix protocol invite 2a claimer
Bugfix invite_2a_claimer
Workspaces are unnecessarily browsed for "prevent sync pattern" analysis when logging in
body:
For large organizations, we sporadically observed a long login time. This is due the workspaces being sometimes unnecessarily browsed for "prevent sync pattern" analysis. This analysis should only be performed when the `default_pattern.ignore` file has changed, but a subtle bug in the comparison of the generated regexes caused a full analysis to be triggered on all logins, except for the first one.

This is due to patterns of the form `*a*` to be translated to different regexes every time `fnmatch.translate` is called.
```python
In [1]: import fnmatch

In [2]: fnmatch.translate("*.*.sb-*-*")
Out[2]: '(?s:(?=(?P<g0>.*?\\.))(?P=g0)(?=(?P<g1>.*?\\.sb\\-))(?P=g1)(?=(?P<g2>.*?\\-))(?P=g2).*)\\Z'

In [3]: fnmatch.translate("*.*.sb-*-*")
Out[3]: '(?s:(?=(?P<g3>.*?\\.))(?P=g3)(?=(?P<g4>.*?\\.sb\\-))(?P=g4)(?=(?P<g5>.*?\\-))(?P=g5).*)\\Z'
```

title: Force maturin to use venv Python interpreter
Relax `test_eyeballs` expected delay timeout to 1s
body: On the test `test_eyeballs` we check if it don't take too much time to execute. The minimal possible value for the test is `800ms` (`TIMEOUT * 2 + 300`). Previously we were adding 100ms for the overhead of async code but time to time the test will fail. Here we're adding another 100ms for the overhead and should drastically reduce the number of false positive

title: [🐛 | Bug]: Incorrect content-type header when client uses anonymous rpc api
body:
### Version

<=2.11.1

### What happened ?

According to [urlib.request.Request documentation](https://docs.python.org/3/library/urllib.request.html#urllib.request.Request):

> An appropriate Content-Type header should be included if the data argument is present. If this header has not been provided and data is not None, Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded will be added as a default.

So we currently send `application/x-www-form-urlencoded` as content type instead of `application/msgpack`

title: [🐛 | Bug]: libcrypto dependency issue with snap on Ubuntu 22
body:
### Version

2.11.0

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Linux

### What happened ?

Same issue as the one we had with `libfuse`: https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/ed557534189b37c1f381e73109f482854aa813c8/packaging/snap/bin/parsec#L19

Here, `oscrypto` uses `find_library` to find `libcrypto`, except ubuntu 22 gives the following:
```python
% python3
Python 3.10.4 (main, Jun 29 2022, 12:14:53) [GCC 11.2.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> from ctypes.util import find_library
>>> find_library("crypto")
'libcrypto.so.3'
```
So the `.so.3` file gets loaded instead of the expected `.so.1.1`

title: [🐛 | Bug]: [Sequester][GUI] Gui does not display active sequester
body:
### Version

V2-11-0-rc2

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Linux

### What happened ?

Active sequester is not printed on organization widget.

### Relevant output

It appears that the sequester authority is always none due to mismatch in sequester config reply:
config loads:
```python
sequester_authority=rep.get("sequester_authority"),
sequester_services=rep.get("sequester_services"),

```
It shall be:
```python
sequester_authority=rep.get("sequester_authority_certificate"),
sequester_services=rep.get("sequester_services_certificates"),
```

title: rename generated artifact by libparsec python
body: closes #2637

title: `libparsec` and `libparsec_python` are creating artifact with the same name
body:
rust crates `oxidation/libparsec` and `oxidation/libparsec_python` are creating artifact with the same name because of `libparsec_python` being configured as follow

```toml
[lib]
name = "libparsec"
# "cdylib" is necessary to produce a shared library for Python to import from.
crate-type = ["cdylib"]
```

I we were to use the lib `libparsec` for something other than binding to rust, right now we would be using the lib generated by `libparsec_python`

title: [🐛 | Bug]: Invalid `from_http_redirection` rust implementation
body:
### Version

N/A

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Linux

### What happened ?

the check for `redirect` in url path is invalid

https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/de94b157ee8dabb0b029afb143845200b8618191/oxidation/crates/parsec_api_types/src/addr.rs#L67-L73

[`Url::path_segments`](https://docs.rs/url/latest/url/struct.Url.html#method.path_segments) would return `Some("")` when the path is empty.

So every `url` that contain something other than an empty path would pass the check

### Relevant output

consider the following test case for `BackendAddr`

```rust
#[rstest]
#[case("https://foo.bar/", false)]
#[case("https://foo.bar/redirection", false)]
#[case("https://foo.bar/redirect", true)]
#[case("https://foo.bar/not_valid", false)]
fn test_faulty_addr_redirection(#[case] raw_url: &str, #[case] is_valid: bool) {
    let res = dbg!(BackendAddr::from_http_redirection(raw_url));

    assert_eq!(res.is_ok(), is_valid)
}
```

title: [🐛 | Bug]: Revoked status not propagated correctly to other users
body:
### Version

v2.10.0-rc1

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Windows

### What happened ?

If Alice gets revoked by Bob, Carl is supposed to get notified that Alice is revoked.

However, Carl does not see Alice as revoked in the user list, even though the "hide revoked user" button **does** behave correctly, hiding Alice profile. Carl can also share a workspace with Alice, and the snackbar indicates this has been done successfully. Then Alice **does** appear as revoked in the user list and **does not** appear in the list of the workspace roles. 

We should make sure that the workspace key has not been sent to Alice in the process.

### Relevant output

_No response_

body:
### Version

Latest

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Windows, Linux, MacOS

### What happened ?

When switching between workspaces (or going back to the same workspace), the previously browsed file list appears while the new list is being loaded. The behavior makes sense when browsing to a subdirectory (i.e show the current directory while the subdirectory is being loaded) but the widget should be cleared when the files widget gets hidden.

title: Fix/2418 bug ci dont fully test rust code

labels.name: CI / CD
labels.description: Issue related to the CI / CD

body:
This PR correct the CI that does not run all rust test.

It also configure `clippy` on the workspace side using `pre-commit`, I suggest rust dev to configure their IDE to use a similar `clippy` configuration (you mostly only need the arguments after `--`)

example How I configure vscode on my side:
```json
{
    "rust-analyzer.checkOnSave.command": "clippy",
    "rust-analyzer.checkOnSave.extraArgs": [
        "--",
        "--deny=clippy::self_named_module_files"
    ]
}
```
closes #2418, closes #2277

title: [🐛 | Bug]: CI don't fully test rust code
body:
### Version

All

### What happened ?

currently we execute Rust test like so:

https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/fd6e9aa97e85f69c25f54baced4d5cf994831cd9/.azure-pipelines.yml#L205

but this only execute the test of the main crate.

we should replace by 

```
cargo test --workspace
```
or
```
cargo test -p package_a
cargo test -p package_b [specific option]
```

### Relevant output

_No response_

title: [🐛 | Bug]: Quadratic slowdown in GUI when opening big folders
body:
### Version

2.8.0+

### What platforms you were running our software when the bug happened ?

Windows

### What happened ?

On Windows, the folder view in the GUI is very slow to display big folder.
- it is not a network issue as the slow down is the same when going backward and re-entering the folder
- ~the issue is not present on Linux (tested with Parsec 2.9.2 on Ubuntu 20.04)~ edit: issue can be reproduced on Linux with a 4K screen (see comment below)
- ~the issue might be related to the `ItemDelegate.paint` (I've done some profiling and this part is called a lot, see screenshot)~ edit: removing `ItemDelegate` doesn't fix the slowdown, on the other hand using dummy data with `ItemDelegate` is instantaneous, so issue seems to come from scheduling the trio async function responsible for fetching the data

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3187637/171478479-dbebf3e0-5823-4d72-9fc2-54f1c6828bdc.png)

title: Blank page after opening a file link with no access when logged out
body: To replicate: 1. Be logged out of the organization 2. Click link of file for which we don't have access 3. Log in with password Which results in an entirely blank page. This doesn't occur if already logged in the org, instead raises an error and loads the widgets correctly. This _might_ be mac-only.

title: Opening GUI with file link
body:
Opening the GUI with a valid file link, eg `parsec core gui "parsec://localhost:6888/Org?action=file_link&workspace_id=d164a88ead1c4d4f9c05632cc5660820&path=QD3WUB2IOJI6QIVCMZDILQPHWVOXCEHYALAVCAB7BNC7ONLVYGDPKZ6HJTTDIXGLQT4KUKRYR2VBVHKXQHZICM2PN6K5K2RY755ENKQ3&no_ssl=true"` results in the following display:
![error_file_link](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/18075498/163342422-a3195003-138c-486e-96a3-eed98e32d424.png)

Devices list should be hidden.

It's due to the async load of devices in `LoginWidget`. What happens is:
- login widget is loaded, the layout is cleared, a job is started to get the device list and fill the layout
- the link is processed, we call `LoginWidget._on_account_clicked` with the device, it clears the layout but it is empty
- the jobs finishes and fills the layout with the devices

title: Too much data for declared Content-Length
body:
```
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1 2022-03-13T23:51:40.633805Z [error    ] Unexpected crash               
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1 Traceback (most recent call last):
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/parsec/backend/cli/run.py", line 623, in _serve_client
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     await backend.handle_client(stream)
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/parsec/backend/app.py", line 194, in handle_client
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     await self._handle_client_http(stream, conn, event)
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/parsec/backend/app.py", line 276, in _handle_client_http
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     await self._send_http_reply(
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/parsec/backend/app.py", line 230, in _send_http_reply
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     await stream.send_all(conn.send(h11.Data(data=data)))
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/h11/_connection.py", line 468, in send
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     data_list = self.send_with_data_passthrough(event)
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/h11/_connection.py", line 501, in send_with_data_passthrough
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     writer(event, data_list.append)
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/h11/_writers.py", line 58, in __call__
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     self.send_data(event.data, write)
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1   File "/app/.heroku/python/lib/python3.8/site-packages/h11/_writers.py", line 78, in send_data
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1     raise LocalProtocolError("Too much data for declared Content-Length")
Mar 14 00:51:41 parsec-cloud-prod app/web.1 h11._util.LocalProtocolError: Too much data for declared Content-Length
```

on sentry: https://sentry.io/organizations/scille/issues/3088888740/?project=5953612&query=server_name%3A%22parsec-cloud-test-web-1%22

Error should come from here https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/64d26788c733b38db12c480754e9e730b32dc475/parsec/backend/app.py#L214-L230

where content length is calculated from len(data), which is very similar to what is done in h11 documentation:
```
# from https://h11.readthedocs.io/en/latest/examples.html
async def send_simple_response(wrapper, status_code, content_type, body):
    wrapper.info("Sending", status_code, "response with", len(body), "bytes")
    headers = wrapper.basic_headers()
    headers.append(("Content-Type", content_type))
    headers.append(("Content-Length", str(len(body))))
    res = h11.Response(status_code=status_code, headers=headers)
    await wrapper.send(res)
    await wrapper.send(h11.Data(data=body))
    await wrapper.send(h11.EndOfMessage())
```

Error seems to come when a 404 is hit (given the 404 page is constant, is content-length is always 823octets, which is correct in the header reported by sentry, however h11 complains about too much data...)

title: Forced LISTEN query termination on postgres end is not detected by the backend
body:
The backend uses a long lasting LISTEN query to pass all the events:
https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/b80cdb3922da9bf1614900885d8244b294cafd1c/parsec/backend/postgresql/handler.py#L229-L231

If for whatever reason the PostgreSQL server decides to terminate this LISTEN query, the backend doesn't seem to be notified about it (no exception is raised), so it becomes "blind": no event can be provided to it and it cannot tell if it's because there is no currently no events or because it cannot see them !

We should find a way to make sure this doesn't occur:
- ideally to get an exception is if the query is terminated (so we can log the trouble and restart the query)
- restarting the query periodically. However it doesn't look like a very good solution given it brings concurrency issues when the query is restarted and we should look for short query time to minimize "blindness time"... but the shorter the query time, the bigger the concurrency issues !

title: GUI freezes in some Linux
body:
The Qt GUI sometimes blocks and freezes on some Linux platforms. The window hangs and the only way to close the window is to click on the window close cross and wait for the system "not responding" and select Force Quit (also CTRL+C in the terminal or kill).

To trigger it, run many times (something like 1 over 20 tests is blocking for ever) :
`python3 -m pytest -x tests/core/gui/test_files.py::test_cut_files -runmountpoint --runslow --rungui -m gui -v`
If starting a full gui test with all the tests, there is a high probability the issue happens as there are hundreds of tests, so one will be face this and will freeze forever the GUI window.
It also happens outside of pytest, when we "manually" use the GUI core GUI.

Affected systems are Ubuntu 20.04 (Python38) and Ubuntu 18.04 (Python36), but we didn't reproduced that issue on a physical computer nor a local VM, it was only present on a remote machine through RDP, using the X11 windowing system instead of the modern wayland.

We did the following without any success trying to solve this issue :
* downgrade pyQt to 5.13.0, 5.13.1 and 5.13.2
* upgrade pyQt to 5.15.1
* add many QCoreApplication.processEvents() in the code, maybe we missed a keypoint or the required one was QApplication

The possible root causes can be :
* An issue with Qt5 and x11
* A mishandling of Qt5 GUI, like missing .processEvents()
* An issue with threading or trio (deadlock, lost thread,...)

Looks like, the GUI didn't even contact the server, because of this breaking change about organization_bootstrap arguments.

Also, the Windows GUI client creates locally the user data. So at next parsec startup, it asks for the user login, then can't connect to server. "Failed to retrieve user list from the server", "Disconnected". It shouldn't create anything locally if the bootstrap (or join) is not successful.

Working correctly with python 3.7.

title: Trio deadlock when importing a file from a parsec workspace
body:

https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/adc66c9b548fc4ed53903f9be0d914bb204da5b7/parsec/core/gui/files_widget.py#L99-L109

The fix: use [trio.open_file](https://trio.readthedocs.io/en/stable/reference-io.html#trio.open_file)

```

This is probably due to the sync_monitor raising an `FSBackendOfflineError` where the backend connection monitor only consider `BackendNotAvailable` and `BackendConnectionRefused` as valid switch-to-offline exceptions

I think a solution to deal with this once and for all would be to make `FSBackendOfflineError` inherit from `BackendNotAvailable`, but I'm fear of possible hidden consequences... @vxgmichel any idea on this ?

title: Bug: pas d'actualisation de la liste des devices après rajout d'un nouveau (sur le device invitant)
body:
Manip:
- PC DELL-PHIL W10 64b
2 devices visibles
- invitation à ajouter un troisième device Bureau-W10-32b     W10 32b
Tout se passe bien, mais : 
- la liste des 3 devices apparait bien sur le nouveau device
- sur le premier DELL-PHIL, à l'origine de l'invitation, le nouveau device n'apparait pas malgré
1/ deconnexion - reconnexion 2/ fermeture parsec - relance - reconnexion 3/ reboot pc

Sur le nouveau device : 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13103240/77345887-8b8a1c80-6d35-11ea-87f4-14641879a5a1.png)

title: Incorrect "Role on workspace x has changed" notifications
body: Some notifications are sent incorrectly, which might be the symptom of a deeper problem.

title: Disable file modifications for a reader
body:
GUI is mostly lighter for a reader on a workspace, preventing some operations that will result in errors anyway to even be performed. Some of them can still be tried though:
- copy/paste operations using either the menu or the keyboard shortcuts
- deletions using the del key
- files drag&drop (either internal or from the explorer)

title: Files update are not displayed automatically by the GUI
body:
- When a workspace is open on a directory and files are added to this directory by another user, the display is not automatically updated (forcing a reload of the current directory). This also occurs with renaming but not with deletions.
- Files in the workspaces are not automatically shown when files are added to the workspace

title: Installer issues when executed with a non-admin account on Windows
body:
When installing on Windows with a non-admin user, Windows prompt for the admin password, and the whole environment is switched to the admin's one during installation. This raises several issues:
- registry keys for HKCU are written for the admin (https://github.com/Scille/parsec-build/blob/master/win32/installer.nsi#L265)
- the mountpoint is created in admin's home (https://github.com/Scille/parsec-build/blob/master/win32/installer.nsi#L15)
- if "create desktop shortcut" is checked, the shortcut is created on admin's desktop
- if "execute Parsec" is checked, Parsec is executed with admin account

title: Clear password field when switching device
Default rights on mountpoint
body: Currently the mountpoint has 755 rights on it, which allows a user on the same machine to see files contained in the mountpoint if Parsec is started.

title: [GUI] Disable Paste button and display error when paste failed
GUI should warn when trying to cut/paste a directory into itself
Paste menu option should be disabled if nothing has been cut/copied

title: Log in button not instantly available for clicking on windows
body:
On windows, the log button is not instantly available for clicking after the password has been typed.
One has to either wait 1 second before clicking, or use the `Enter` key to validate the password.

title: Parsec ubuntu GUI buttons are shown in different windows (see picture)
body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8625772/67850398-9d5def80-fb08-11e9-8a48-b1934074bef6.png)

title: Using '..' as folder name causes linux client to not open a file inside the directory
body:
Steps to reproduce :

1. Create a ".." directory with parsec linux app.
2. Drop a file in the new directory.
3. Open the file (double click). Actual result : nothing happens.

".." is reserved on unix for link to parent folder.

title: Mount point crashes when it contains characters forbidden in Windows
body:
Windows (compared to Linux) does not accept certain characters like '<', '>', etc.

To reproduce :
1. Create a workspace using the linux parsec client, having "<><>" in the name. Add files in the workspace.
2. Share the workspace with a windows device.
3. On the windows device, the client shows folder structure well, but the mount point is stale (crashed).

title: Core should verify the chain of signatures to validate the role of the user (writer, owner etc.)
body:
Currently, the verification of the user roles is performed only by the back-end. The same verification should be performed by users after receiving content from metadata server.

This mechanism is similar with validating administrative signed operations, which happen both at the back-end and at the users side.

title: English is selected by default in settings/language even if French is active.
body: The dropdown in the language settings does not reflect the active selected language.

title: Current user can see directories of previous user after uninstall
body:
Using Ubuntu 18.04.2 LTS :

1. Create a parsec user, add some directories to the mountpoint.
2. Uninstall parsec on client.
3. Re-install using snap.
4. Create a new user and log-in.
5. The mount point displays directories that were created by previous user - security issue.

title: A clean install of snap requires including "--dangerous" in cmd line
body:
We should not be asked for "--dangerous" in snap install cmd line. 

Command that I had to use to clean install `snap install --classic --dangerous parsec_v1.0.1_amd64.snap`

title: Deux devices tournant sur un même machine virtuelle Windows 10 n'ont pas le même contenu
body:
Un permier device `Windows10` est créé sur un environnement virtuel Windows10. Il se synchronise sans problème avec le device Linux du même user.
Pour une raison inconnue, quelques jours plus trad, le contenu en workspace disparaît alors que l'environnement Linux, rien ne change.
On recréer un autre device `Win10bis` dans l'environnement virtuel Windows10. Le contenu des WS est identique à la celui du device Linux.
On se retrouve avec deux devices d'un même utilisateur, tournant sur le même environnement virtuel Windows10, qui n'ont pas le même contenu car l'un est vide.

Liens complémentaires (Manu) : 
- Erreur = https://sentry.io/organizations/scille/issues/1257565263/?project=1212848&query=is%3Aunresolved&statsPeriod=14d
- Erreur qui a l'air d'entrainer ça https://sentry.io/organizations/scille/issues/1257587344/?project=1212848&query=is%3Aunresolved&statsPeriod=14d

Manu : "Pépère sur sa machine virtuelle a créé un device qui n'affiche aucun workspaces
après ça il a créé un nouveau device et là pas de soucis les workspaces apparaissent bien"

title: Crash de la connexion lorsque le raccourci existe déjà mais ne fonctionne plus
body:
Sous Windows, lorsque pour une raison divers liée par exemple à un arrêt intempestif lors d'une précédente session, on essaie de se loguer de nouveau, Parsec ne peut pas faire le point de montage sur le raccourci cassé existant.
Il faut alors supprimer à la main tous les raccorucis sur le répertoire parsec_mnt pour pouvoir se loguer de nouveau.
Il faudrait systématiquement au moment de la phase de connexion, supprimer prélablement tous les points de montage existants précédents.

title: Show mountpoint in Wirdows Explorer left panel not working

title: .fuse_hidden... files cause tests to fail
body:
https://travis-ci.org/Scille/parsec-cloud/builds/555798612#L3993

```
self = FolderOperationsStateMachine({'file': [VarReference(name='v2')], 'folder': [VarReference(name='v1')]})
path = PathElement(absolute_path='/w', parsec_root=PosixPath('/tmp/pytest-of-travis/pytest-0/popen-gw1/test_folder_operations...c-1/w'), oracle_root=PosixPath('/tmp/pytest-of-travis/pytest-0/popen-gw1/test_folder_operations1/oracle-test-39/root'))
    @rule(path=Folders)
    def iterdir(self, path):
        expected_exc = None
        try:
            expected_children = {x.name for x in path.to_oracle().iterdir()}
        except OSError as exc:
            expected_exc = exc
    
        with expect_raises(expected_exc):
            children = {x.name for x in path.to_parsec().iterdir()}
    
        if not expected_exc:
>           assert children == expected_children
E           AssertionError: assert {'.fuse_hidde...000200000001'} == set()
E             Extra items in the left set:
E             '.fuse_hidden0000000200000001'
E             Full diff:
E             - {'.fuse_hidden0000000200000001'}
E             + set()
../tests/core/mountpoint/test_folder_operations.py:222: AssertionError
----------------------------- Captured stdout call -----------------------------
Falsifying example: run_state_machine(factory=FolderOperationsStateMachine, data=data(...))
state = FolderOperationsStateMachine()
v1 = state.init()
v2 = state.touch(name='ab', parent=v1)
state.unlink(path=v2)
state.iterdir(path=v1)
state.teardown()
You can reproduce this example by temporarily adding @reproduce_failure('4.5.5', b'AAH8AwEAmwEUAAcCAHkAAA==') as a decorator on your test case
----------------------------- Captured stderr call -----------------------------
```

`.fuse_hidden...` files are created by fuse when a file is removed while beeing open
The test never try to remove an opened file so the reasons for the issue I can think of are:
- pathlib does an open in our back and Python GC makes trigger the close too late
- another process did the open while scanning the directory

The solution to get ride of this would be to use the `hard_remove`&`nullpath_ok` for fuse. Which means modify parsec folder handling to allow them to be opened and return a file descriptor...

title: Delete dirty blocks after successive writes
body: En cas d'écritures successives (deux échos rapides dans un fichier), les dirty blocs ne sont pas tous supprimés après synchro.

title: Workspace list refresh
body: Si on supprime le local cache, lorsqu'on relance parsec, le workspace n’apparaît plus et il faut changer de rubrique pour le refaire apparaître.

title: asyncpg.exceptions.UniqueViolationError under concurrency with Postgresql
body: see: https://travis-ci.org/Scille/parsec-cloud/builds/550848875?utm_source=github_status&utm_medium=notification

title: Fix trustchain issue when inviting a new user
Avoid using user_find when adding a new user
body: user_find uses globbing, which means that it is currently impossible to add a user if multiple caracters overlap.

title: Fix workspaces/users/devices display on low resolutions
body: Workspaces, users and devices are displayed using a 4 columns grid. On low resolutions, items on the right can become cut off or invisible. Either use a 3 columns grid on low resolution, or an horizontal scrollbar.

title: Handle error when trying to log in with the same device on two instances
Error reporting on claim user timeout
Fix the login page on low resolutions
body: On low resolution, bottom fields can be cut off. Add a scrollbar.

title: Limit the "new version available" popup to Windows
Default language depending on OS language
body: Seen on a machine running a French version of Windows. The GUI still uses English as the default language.

title: The monitor sync should not trigger recursive synchronization
body: Only the manifest that has changed (remotely or locally) should get synchronized when the monitor sync decides  that the time is right (depending on the MIN_WAIT/MAX_WAIT policy).

title: Block size needs to be strictly lower than the transport buffer size
body:
There is a 1MB maximum buffer size defined in `parsec.api.transport`, 

https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/b07fe93ff19863b9c49abba542f202710584ff37/parsec/api/transport.py#L38

and 1MB maximum block size defined in `parsec.core.fs.workspacefs.sync_transactions`:

https://github.com/Scille/parsec-cloud/blob/b07fe93ff19863b9c49abba542f202710584ff37/parsec/core/fs/workspacefs/sync_transactions.py#L27

The limits appear to be in conflict when uploading a 1MB block:
```python-tb
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/sync_monitor.py", line 74, in _monitoring
    await self._monitoring_loop()
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/sync_monitor.py", line 106, in _monitoring_loop
    await self._monitoring_tick(updated_entries)
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/sync_monitor.py", line 147, in _monitoring_tick
    await workspace.sync_by_id(id)
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/fs/workspacefs/workspacefs.py", line 459, in sync_by_id
    await self.sync_by_id(entry_id, remote_changed=remote_changed, recursive=True)
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/fs/workspacefs/workspacefs.py", line 441, in sync_by_id
    manifest = await self._sync_by_id(entry_id, remote_changed=remote_changed)
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/fs/workspacefs/workspacefs.py", line 417, in _sync_by_id
    await self._upload_blocks(new_remote_manifest)
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/fs/workspacefs/workspacefs.py", line 346, in _upload_blocks
    await self.remote_loader.upload_block(access, data)
  File "/home/vinmic/parsec-cloud/parsec/core/fs/remote_loader.py", line 137, in upload_block
    raise FSError(f"Cannot upload block: {exc}") from exc
parsec.core.fs.exceptions.FSError: Cannot upload block: {'reason': 'Invalid message format', 'status': 'invalid_msg_format'}
```
A quick workaround is to lower the block size or increase the buffer size.

@touilleMan is there more to it?

title: LocalStorageMissingError when receiving notifications from a non-loaded workspace
body:
This happens when receiving a `remote_changed` notification from a workspace that has never been loaded. This mean the workspace manifest does not exist in the local storage and an exception is raised. Simply ignoring this exception seems to be an acceptable fix.

title: Fix config being overwritten
Handle connected/disconnected status correctly
Error when running the `rename` and `move` windows commands
body:
Taken from a windows test session with @frossigneux on #390:

```
C:\Users\Rossigneux\parsec_mnt\alice-alice_workspace>rename C D
Le fichier spécifié est introuvable.
C:\Users\Rossigneux\parsec_mnt\alice-alice_workspace>move D A
Le fichier spécifié est introuvable.
```

The winfsp mountpoint appears to work as expected when using file explorer or the python `os.rename` function:

```python
>>> os.rename("baz.txt", "E\\foo.txt")

>>>

title: Workspace file list preview not updated
body:
Si un utilisateur me partage un fichier, je le vois :
- Immédiatement dans le point de montage via l'explorateur
- Pas dans la fenêtre parsec (au niveau du sommaire des workspaces)

Après un bout de temps, j'ai cliqué sur le workspage :
- J'y ai vu le fichier
- En revenant au sommaire des workspaces j'ai vu le fichier dans la liste de preview

Donc : est-ce que la liste de preview des fichiers dans le workspace doit se synchroniser avec une latence ?

title: Issue when uploading a file using the file explorer on windows
body:
Seen on @Usersdub windows system. When pasting a file in a workspace, a window pops up:

> Voulez-vous vraiment déplacer ce fichier sans ses propriétés ? Le fichier [...] possède des prorpiétés qui ne peuvent aps etre déplacées dans le nouvel emplacement

Then the file is correctly uploaded and shared (it can be opened from another machine). But when @Usersdub tries to open the file he just pasted (using either the GUI or the file explorer), another error message is displayed:

> Il semble que nous ne prenions pas en charge ce format de fichier

This problem does not occur when the file is uploaded using the GUI. This problem is most probably related to winfsp.

title: [Investigation] Discrepancy between file system and GUI
body: Sometimes, a new file (created from another device) might appear in the file system but not in the GUI. This issue is about finding a reliable way to reproduce the problem.

title: Regression in FSOnlineConcurrentTreeAndSync
body:
```python-traceback
    def set_clean_manifest(self, access: Access, raw: bytes):
        if self._check_presence(self.dirty_conn, access):
>           raise ValueError("Cannot set clean manifest: a dirty manifest is already present")
E           ValueError: Cannot set clean manifest: a dirty manifest is already present

parsec/core/persistent_storage.py:255: ValueError
```

```python
Falsifying example: run_state_machine(factory=FSOnlineConcurrentTreeAndSync, data=data(...))

state = FSOnlineConcurrentTreeAndSync()
async def steps():
    v1 = await state.init()
    v2 = await state.register_fs2(force_after_init=v1)
    v3 = await state.register_fs1(force_after_init=v1)
    v4 = await state.create_workspace(fs=v3, name='a')
    v5 = await state.create_file(fs=v3, name='a', parent=v4)
    await state.sync_all_the_files()
    await state.update_file(fs=v3, path=v5)
    await state.update_file(fs=v2, path=v5)
    await state.sync_all_the_files()
    await state.update_file(fs=v3, path=v5)
    await state.sync_all_the_files()
    await state.teardown()
state.trio_run(steps)

You can reproduce this example by temporarily adding @reproduce_failure('4.5.5', b'AXicY2RgZGQAQjYgwcDIAiJBXGYgycwIYzEAAALXACM=') as a decorator on your test case
```

title: Dismount an inopperant workspace after changing its name
body:
The bug : 
- Create  a new  workspace "Bille 4"
- The workspace is automatically mounted --> OK
- Change the name of the workspace into "Bulle 4"
- The old workspace stay mounted even if it is no more operational

The correction proposed : once a workspace is renamed, automatically dismount the old name in the mounted point.

title: Local data stored in wrong folder
body:
cf. #322 

les données locales sont stockées dans `~/.local/share/parsec/<user_id>@<device_name>` mais ça devrait être `~/.local/share/parsec/<organization_id>#<user_id>@<device_name>`

title: Fuse mountpoints swallow the first SIGTERM
body:
Steps:

```shell
$ source misc/run_test_environment.sh
[...]
$ parsec core run -P test -D corp:alice@laptop
alice@laptop's drive mounted at /home/vinmic/parsec_mnt
^Z
[1]  + 28967 suspended  parsec core run -P test -D corp:alice@laptop
$ kill %1
$ fg
[1]  + 28967 continued  parsec core run -P test -D corp:alice@laptop
^Z
[1]  + 28967 suspended  parsec core run -P test -D corp:alice@laptop
$ kill -INT %1
fuse: fuse_remove_signal_handlers: unknown session
bye ;-)
[1]  + 28967 done       parsec core run -P test -D corp:alice@laptop
```

Workaround:
- set custom signal handlers for `SIGTERM` and `SIGHUP` when starting a mountpoint
- or reset signal handlers for `SIGTERM` and `SIGHUP` after a mountpoint is started

title: GUI: handle mountpoint already in use at login
GUI: handle BackendHandshakeError at login
Moving a file from a workspace to root causes a crash
body:
Steps to reproduce:
```console
$ source misc/run_test_environment.sh
[...]
$ DEBUG= parsec core run -P test -D corp:alice@laptop
[...]
# In a new terminal
$ touch ~/parsec_mnt/alice@laptop/alice_workspace/test            
$ mv ~/parsec_mnt/alice@laptop/alice_workspace/test ~/parsec_mnt/alice@laptop
```
The `mv` command is expected to fail since it is not allowed to have a file in the root directory.

Instead, the `parsec core run` instance crashes with the following trace:
```
Error: 
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/vinmic/miniconda/envs/parsec/bin/parsec", line 11, in <module>
    load_entry_point('parsec-cloud', 'console_scripts', 'parsec')()

    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/vinmic/miniconda/envs/parsec/lib/python3.7/site-packages/click/core.py", line 717, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
